data.quote: We are given children to test us and make us more spiritual.
data.author: George Will

data.quote: One laugh of a child will make the holiest day more sacred still.
data.author: Robert G. Ingersoll

data.quote: Children are the true connoisseurs. What's precious to them has no price - only value.
data.author: Bel Kaufman

data.quote: There are no seven wonders of the world in the eyes of a child. There are seven million.
data.author: Walt Streightiff

data.quote: Children  like animals  use all their senses to discover the world. Then artists come along and discover it the same way all over again.
data.author: Eudora Welty

data.quote: The only artists for whom I would make way are - children. For me the paintings of children belong side by side with the works of the masters.
data.author: Henry Miller

data.quote: Why  a four-year-old child could understand this report. Run out and find me a four-year-old child.
data.author: Groucho Marx

data.quote: Adults are always asking little kids what they want to be when they grow up - 'cause they're looking for ideas.
data.author: Paula Poundstone

data.quote: What do we teach our children? . . . We should say to each of them: Do you know what you are? You are a marvel. You are unique . . . You may become a Shakespeare  a Michelangelo  a Beethoven. You have the capacity for anything.
data.author: Pablo Casals

data.quote: By giving children lots of affection  you can help fill them with love and acceptance of themselves. Then that's what they will have to give away.
data.author: Wayne Dyer

data.quote: Teaching kids to count is fine  but teaching them what counts is best.
data.author: Bob Talbert

data.quote: It is infinitely more useful for a child to hear a story told by a person than by computer. Because the greatest part of the learning experience lies not in the particular words of the story but in the involvement with the individual reading it.
data.author: Frank Smith

data.quote: The parents exist to teach the child  but also they must learn what the child has to teach them  and the child has a very great deal to teach them.
data.author: Arnold Bennett

data.quote: Grown men can learn from very little children for the hearts of little children are pure. Therefore  the Great Spirit may show to them many things which older people miss.
data.author: Black Elk

data.quote: Children have a remarkable talent for not taking the adult world with the kind of respect we are so confident it ought to be given. To the irritation of authority figures of all sorts  children expend considerable energy in "clowning around." They refuse to appreciate the gravity of our monumental concerns  while we forget that if we were to become more like children our concerns might not be so monumental.
data.author: Conrad Hyers

data.quote: Youth I Stay close to the young  and a little rubs off.
data.author: Alan Jay Lerner

data.quote: Those who love the young best stay young longer.
data.author: Edgar Friedenberg

data.quote: As long as I continue to hear "normal" people telling me I am too childish  I know I'm doing just fine.
data.author: Wayne Dyer

data.quote: One of the most obvious facts about grownups to a child is that they have forgotten what it is like to be a child.
data.author: Randall Jarrell

data.quote: All of us collect fortunes when we are children. A fortune of colors  of lights  and darkness  of movement  of tensions. Some of us have the fantastic chance to go back to his fortune when grown up.
data.author: Ingmar Bergman

data.quote: So  like a forgotten fire  a childhood can always flare up again within us.
data.author: Gaston Bachelard

data.quote: The great man is he that does not lose his child-heart.
data.author: Mencius

data.quote: What God is to the world  parents are to their children.
data.author: Philo

data.quote: Honor your father and your mother.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Honor your father and mother  even as you honor God  for all three were partners in your creation.
data.author: Zohar

data.quote: When I was a boy of fourteen  my father was so ignorant I could hardly stand to have the old man around. But when I got to be twenty-one  I was astonished at how much the old man had learned in seven years.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: Remember  no matter how many candles you blow out this year  there's one gal who will always think of you as young  strong and handsome - your mother.
data.author: Susan D. Anderson

data.quote: There's no way to be a perfect mother and a million ways to be a good one.
data.author: Jill Churchill

data.quote: God could not be everywhere  therefore he made mothers.
data.author: Jewish saying

data.quote: Parents are often so busy with the physical rearing of children that they miss the glory of parenthood  just as the grandeur of the trees is lost when raking leaves.
data.author: Marcelene Cox

data.quote: The best inheritance a parent can give his children is a few minutes of his time each day.
data.author: O. A. Battista

data.quote: If I had known how wonderful it would be to have grandchildren  I'd have had them first.
data.author: Lois Wyse

data.quote: Few things are more delightful than grandchildren fighting over your lap.
data.author: Doug Larson

data.quote: The greatest sweetener of human life is Friendship.
data.author: Joseph Addison

data.quote: A friend might well be reckoned the masterpiece of nature.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Of all the things which wisdom provides to make us entirely happy  much the greatest is the possession of friendship.
data.author: Epicurus

data.quote: Friendship is the only cement that will ever hold the world together.
data.author: Woodrow Wilson

data.quote: The glory of friendship is not the outstretched hand  nor the kindly smile  nor the joy of companionship  it is the spiritual inspiration that comes to one when he discovers that someone else believes in him and is willing to trust him.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: What a great blessing is a friend with a heart so trusty you may safely bury all your secrets in it.
data.author: Seneca

data.quote: When a friend is in trouble  don't annoy him by asking if there is anything you can do. Think up something appropriate and do it.
data.author: Edgar Watson Howe

data.quote: A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out.
data.author: Walter Winchell

data.quote: The most I can do for my friend is simply to be his friend.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: Friendship improves happiness  and abates misery  by doubling our joy  and dividing our grief.
data.author: Joseph Addison

data.quote: It is not what you give your friend  but what you are willing to give him  that determines the quality of your friendship.
data.author: Mary Dixon Thayer

data.quote: A friend is someone who knows all about you and loves you just the same.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: It is not the talking that counts between friends  it is the never needing to say what counts.
data.author: Shawn Green

data.quote: True friendship comes when silence between two people is comfortable.
data.author: Dave Tyson Gentry

data.quote: Friendship is a single soul dwelling in two bodies.

data.quote: To be a good friend remember that we are human magnets: that like attracts like and that as we give we get.
data.author: Wilfred Peterson

data.quote: Treat your friends as you do your pictures  and place them in their best light.
data.author: Jennie Jerome Churchill

data.quote: Friendships are fragile things  and require as much care in handling as any other fragile and precious thing.
data.author: Randolph Bourne

data.quote: Every man should have a fair-sized cemetery in which to bury the faults of his friends.
data.author: Henry Brooks Adams

data.quote: Since there is nothing so well worth having as friends  never lose a chance to make them.
data.author: Francesco Guicciardini

data.quote: You can make more friends in two months by becoming more interested in other people than you can in two years by trying to get people interested in you.
data.author: Dale Carnegie

data.quote: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Friends will not only live in harmony  but in melody.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: It is great to have friends when one is young  but indeed it is still more so when you are getting old. When we are young  friends are  like everything else  a matter of course. In the old days we know what it means to have them.

data.quote: Old friends are best. King James used to call for his old shoes  they were the easiest for his feet.

data.quote: Each of us has a spark of life inside us  and our highest endeavor ought to be to set off that spark in one another.

data.quote: Sometimes our light goes out but is blown into flame by another human being. Each of us owes deepest thanks to those who have rekindled this light.

data.quote: Insanity is hereditary  you get it from your children.

data.quote: Human beings are the only creatures on Earth that allow children to come back home.
data.author: Bill Cosby

data.quote: Children have become so expensive that only the poor can afford them.

data.quote: Big sisters are the crabgrass in the lawn of life.

data.quote: My son has taken up meditation - at least it's better than sitting doing nothing.

data.quote: A scout is a boy who dresses like a schmuck. A scoutmaster is a schmuck who dresses like a boy.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: It appears there's a little too much chlorine in their gene pool.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: In America there are two classes of travel -  first class and with children.

data.quote: The best thing to do is to behave in a manner befitting one's age. If you are sixteen and under  try not to go bald.

data.quote: Family is just accident. . . . They don't mean to get on your nerves. They don't even mean to be your family  they just are.

data.quote: Have children while your parents are still young enough to take care of them.

data.quote: Let's face it  there's lots of spoiled kids out there . . . because you can't spank Grandma.

data.quote: You know your children are growing up when they stop asking where they came from and refuse to tell you where they're going.

data.quote: I don't want to say anything about my kids . . . but I go to PTA meetings under an assumed name!

data.quote: Few mistakes can be made by a mother-in-law who is willing to baby-sit.

data.quote: Adolescence is when children start trying to bring up their parents.

data.quote: Adults are just children who earn money.

data.quote: I read one psychologist's theory that said  "Never strike a child in your anger." When could I strike him? When he is kissing me on my birthday? When he's recuperating from measles? Do I slap the Bible out of his hand on Sunday?

data.quote: It takes about five years for a walnut tree to produce nuts  but this is not true of a family tree.

data.quote: My father never raised his hand to any one of his children - except in self-defense.

data.quote: To encourage my little kid to eat I'd sometimes say: "Just pretend it's sand."

data.quote: Ask your child what he wants for dinner only if he's buying.

data.quote: Sis  I've been wondering . . . On my birthday mom always gives me five thousand dollars. How much does she give you?

data.quote: My kid asked if he could borrow ten dollars. When I only gave him five dollars he said  "Okay  since you owe me the other five dollars  we'll call it even."
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Never raise your hands to your kids. It leaves your groin unprotected.

data.quote: Never lend your car to someone you've given birth to.

data.quote: We were so poor we had no hot water. But it didn't matter because we had no bathtub to put it in anyway.

data.quote: In most states you can get a driver's license when you're sixteen years old  which made a lot of sense to me when I was sixteen years old but now seems insane.

data.quote: Home is the place  when you have to go there  they have to take you in.

data.quote: I love being a great-grandparent  but what I hate is being the the mother of a grandparent.

data.quote: A child prodigy is one with highly imaginative parents.

data.quote: There is little less trouble in governing a private family than a whole kingdom.

data.quote: None but a mule denies his family.

data.quote: Sweets to the sweet  farewell!

data.quote: A farmer is always going to be rich next year.

data.quote: "The tradition of the new." Yesterday's avant-gard-experiment is today's chic and tomorrow's cliche.

data.quote: Art produces ugly things which frequently become beautiful with time. Fashion  on the other hand  produces beautiful things which always become ugly with time.

data.quote: Be not the first by whom the new are tried  Nor yet the last to lay the old aside.

data.quote: I see that the fashion wears out more apparel than the man.

data.quote: That that is is.

data.author: French proverb

data.quote: Whatso'er we perpetrate We do but row  we are steered by fate.

data.quote: Whatever limits us we call Fate.

data.quote: Certain signs precede certain events.

data.quote: The worst is not always certain but it's very likely.

data.quote: It is a long road from conception to completion.

data.quote: Though men determine  the gods do dispose: and oft times many things fall out between the cup and the lip.

data.quote: The die is cast.

data.quote: The fathers have eaten sour grapes  and the children's teeth are set on edge.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Call no man your father upon the earth: for one is your Father  which is in heaven.
data.author: Matthew

data.quote: It is a wise father that knows his own child.

data.quote: A father is a banker provided by nature.
data.author: French proverb

data.quote: The child is father of the man.
data.author: William Wordsworth

data.quote: There is so much good in the worst of us  And so much bad in the best of us  That it ill behooves any of us To find fault with the rest of us.

data.quote: The greatest of faults  I should say  is to be conscious of none.

data.quote: We must travel in the direction of our fear.

data.quote: Once men are caught up in an event they cease to be afraid. Only the unknown frightens men.

data.quote: Fear is not an unknown emotion to us.

data.quote: I will show you fear in a handful of dust.

data.quote: Just as courage imperils life  fear protects it.

data.quote: Fear comes from uncertainty. When we are absolutely certain  whether of our worth or worthlessness  we are almost impervious to fear. Thus a feeling of utter unworthiness can be a source of courage.
data.author: Eric Hoffer

data.quote: Where no hope is left  is left no fear.

data.quote: The human race is a race of cowards  and I am not only marching in that procession but carrying a banner.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: Men hesitate less to injure a man who makes himself loved than to injure one who makes himself feared  for their love is held by a chain of obligation which  because of men's wickedness  is broken on every occasion for the sake of selfish profit  but their fear is secured by a dread of punishment.
data.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

data.quote: I  a stranger and afraid In a world I never made.
data.author: A. E. Housman

data.quote: Fear has a smell  as Love does.
data.author: Margaret Atwood

data.quote: Fear can be headier than whisky  once man has acquired a taste for it.
data.author: Donald Dowries

data.quote: The suspense is terrible. I hope it will last.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: A good scare is worth more to a man than good advice.

data.quote: How does one kill fear  I wonder? How do you shoot a spectre through the heart  slash off its spectral head  take it by the spectral throat?
data.author: Joseph Conrad

data.quote: In grief we know the worst of what we feel  But who can tell the end of what we fear?
data.author: Hannah More

data.quote: The only way to get rid of my fears is to make films about them.
data.author: Alfred Hitchcock

data.quote: I would often be a coward  but for the shame of it.

data.quote: Horror is a feeling that cannot last long  human nature is incapable of supporting it.
data.author: James de Mille

data.quote: The flocks fear the wolf  the crops the storm  and the trees the wind.

data.quote: We all choke  and the man who says he doesn't choke is lying like hell.
data.author: Lee Trevino

data.quote: All men are afraid in battle. The coward is the one who lets his fear overcome his sense of duty. Duty is the essence of manhood.
data.author: General George S. Patton

data.quote: Only the self-deceived will claim perfect freedom from fear.

data.quote: Every day I wake up a little afraid. Only a fool is never afraid.
data.author: Ron Meyer

data.quote: This is the century of fear.

data.quote: There is perhaps nothing so bad and so dangerous in life as fear.

data.quote: The trouble with most people is that they think with their hopes or fears or wishes rather than with their minds.

data.quote: Fear  true fear  is a savage frenzy. Of all the insanities of which we are capable  it is surely the most cruel.
data.author: Georges Bernanos

data.quote: Fear is the fire that melts Icarian wings.
data.author: Florence Earle Coates

data.quote: There seemed to be endless obstacles-it seemed that the root cause of them all was fear.
data.author: Joanna Field

data.quote: How very little can be done under the spirit of fear.

data.quote: There's no point in burying a hatchet if you're going to put up a marker on the site.
data.author: Sydney J. Harris

data.quote: As long as you don't forgive  who and whatever it is will occupy a rent-free space in your mind.
data.author: Isabelle Holland

data.quote: Courage and clemency are equal virtues.
data.author: Mary Delariviere Manley

data.quote: One may have been a fool  but there's no foolishness like being bitter.
data.author: Kathleen Norris

data.quote: Not the power to remember  but its very opposite  the power to forget  is a necessary condition for our existence.
data.author: Sholem Asch

data.quote: Once a woman has forgiven a man  she must not reheat his sins for breakfast.
data.author: Marlene Dietrich

data.quote: Keeping score of old scores and scars  getting even and one-upping  always make you less than you are.
data.author: Malcolm Forbes

data.quote: Forgiveness is all-powerful. Forgiveness heals all ills.
data.author: Catherine Ponder

data.quote: The forgiving state of mind is a magnetic power for attracting good.
data.author: Catherine Porter

data.quote: Forgiveness is an act of the will  and the will can function regardless of the temperature of the heart.
data.author: Corrie ten Boom

data.quote: To be wronged is nothing unless you continue to remember it.
data.author: Confucius

data.quote: Who understands much  forgives much.
data.author: Madame de Stael

data.quote: Forgiveness is the act of admitting we are like other people.
data.author: Christina Baldwin

data.quote: Grace fills empty spaces  but it can only enter where there is a void to receive it  and it is grace itself which makes this void.
data.author: Simone Weil

data.quote: Know all and you will pardon all.
data.author: Thomas a Kempis

data.quote: People are more than the worst thing they have ever done in their lives.
data.author: Helen Prejean

data.quote: The secret of forgiving everything is to understand nothing.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: Speak not against anyone whose burden you have not weighed yourself.
data.author: Marion Zimmer Bradley

data.quote: Nothing's easier than believing we understand experiences we've never had.
data.author: Gwen Bristow

data.quote: The heart has always the pardoning power.
data.author: Anne-Sophie Swetchine

data.quote: To understand is to forgive  even oneself.
data.author: Alexander Chase

data.quote: To what extent is any given man morally responsible for any given act? We do not know.
data.author: Dr. Alexis Carrel

data.quote: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.
data.author: Mohandas Gandhi

data.quote: Only the brave know how to forgive. ... A coward never forgave  it is not in his nature.
data.author: Laurence Sterne

data.quote: Any man can seek revenge  it takes a king or prince to grant a pardon.
data.author: Arthur J. Rehrat

data.quote: To be angry about trifles is mean and childish  to rage and be furious is brutish  and to maintain perpetual wrath is akin to the practice and temper of devils  but to prevent and suppress rising resentment is wise and glorious  is manly and divine.
data.author: Isaac Watts

data.quote: Hatred is a death wish for the hated  not a life wish for anything else.
data.author: Audre Lorde

data.quote: Hatred is a passion requiring one hundred times the energy of love. Keep it for a cause  not an individual. Keep it for intolerance  injustice  stupidity. For hatred is the strength of the sensitive. Its power and its greatness depend on the selflessness of its use.
data.author: Olive Moore

data.quote: Resentment is the "number one" offender. It destroys more alcoholics than anything else. From it stem all forms of spiritual disease  for we have been not only mentally and physically ill  we have been spiritually sick.
data.author: Alcoholics Anonymous

data.quote: To oppose something is to maintain it.
data.author: Ursula K. LeGuin

data.quote: Dwelling on the negative simply contributes to its power.
data.author: Shirley MacLaine

data.quote: To carry a grudge is like being stung to death by one bee.
data.author: William H. Walton

data.quote: Resentments are burdens we don't need to carry.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The enslaver is enslaved  the hater  harmed.
data.author: Marianne Moore

data.quote: By putting his hand around my neck  he slowly strangled himself.
data.author: Minako Ohba

data.quote: The one who deals the mortal blow receives the mortal wound.
data.author: Maude Parker

data.quote: Without forgiveness life is governed ... by an endless cycle of resentment and retaliation.
data.author: Robert Assaglioli

data.quote: Malice drinks one-half of its own poison.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: I tell you  there is no such thing as creative hate!
data.author: Willa Cather

data.quote: Reject hatred without hating.
data.author: Mary Baker Eddy

data.quote: Hate would destroy him who hated.
data.author: Louis L'Amour

data.quote: In hatred as in love  we grow like the thing we brood upon. What we loathe  we graft into our very soul.
data.author: Mary Renault

data.quote: Resentment is weak and lowers your self-esteem.
data.author: Barbara Sher

data.quote: Hate is a prolonged form of suicide.
data.author: Douglas V. Steere

data.quote: Hatred is like fire-it makes even light rubbish deadly.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: You cannot shake hands with a clenched fist.
data.author: Indira Gandhi

data.quote: Hate is all a lie  there is no truth in hate.
data.author: Kathleen Norris

data.quote: Hate is not a good counselor.
data.author: Victoria Wolff

data.quote: Bitterness imprisons life  love releases it.
data.author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

data.quote: If the will remains in protest  it stays dependent on that which it is protesting against.
data.author: Rollo May

data.quote: Hate smolders and eventually destroys  not the hated but the hater.
data.author: Dorothy Thompson

data.quote: It is almost impossible to throw dirt on someone without getting a little on yourself.
data.author: Abigail Van Buren

data.quote: If you hate a person  you hate something in him that is part of yourself.
data.author: Hermann Hesse

data.quote: Fire destroys that which feeds it.
data.author: Simone Weil

data.quote: You cannot hate other people without hating yourself.
data.author: Oprah Winfrey

data.quote: Whom they have injured  they also hate.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: Rage and bitterness do not foster femininity. They harden the heart and make the body sick.
data.author: Marion Woodman

data.quote: I used to store my anger and it affected my play. Now I get it out. I'm never rude to my playing partner. I'm very focused on the ball. Then it's over.
data.author: Helen Alfredsson

data.quote: Anger is a short madness.
data.author: Horace

data.quote: My mother used to say  "He who angers you conquers you."
data.author: Elizabeth Kenny

data.quote: The angry people are those people who are most afraid.
data.author: Dr. Robert Anthony

data.quote: Anger as soon as fed is dead  'tis starving makes it fat.
data.author: Emily Dickinson

data.quote: Anger dwells only in the bosom of fools.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: Anger and worry are the enemies of clear thought.
data.author: Madeleine Brent

data.quote: Holding on to anger is like grasping a hot coal with the intent of throwing it at someone else  you are the one who gets burned.
data.author: Buddha

data.quote: Anger is a killing thing: it kills the man who angers  for each rage leaves him less than he had been before-it takes something from him.
data.author: Louis L'Amour

data.quote: Something of vengeance I had tasted for the first time  as aromatic wine it seemed  on swallowing  warm and racy  its after-flavor  metallic and corroding  gave me a sensation as if I had been poisoned.
data.author: Charlotte Bronte

data.quote: Revenge could steal a man's life until there was nothing left but emptiness.
data.author: Louis L'Amour

data.quote: Revenge may not be a particularly high consciousness-oriented activity.
data.author: Carrie Fisher

data.quote: The human heart in its perversity finds it hard to escape hatred and revenge.
data.author: Moses Luzzatto

data.quote: A man can lose sight of everything else when he's bent on revenge  and it ain't worth it.
data.author: Louis L'Amour

data.quote: The whole human race loses by every act of personal vengeance.
data.author: Rae Foley

data.quote: Forgiveness is the sweetest revenge.
data.author: Isaac Friedmann

data.quote: One forgives to the degree that one loves.
data.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: One is as one is  and the love that can't encompass both is a poor sort of love.
data.author: Marya Mannes

data.quote: Forgiveness is the final form of love.
data.author: Reinhold Niebuhr

data.quote: The days are too short even for love  how can there be enough time for quarreling?
data.author: Margaret Gatty

data.quote: Forgiveness is the most tender part of love.
data.author: John Sheffield

data.quote: The best proof of love is trust.
data.author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

data.quote: Love is an act of endless forgiveness  a tender look which becomes a habit.
data.author: Peter Ustinov

data.quote: We are told that people stay in love because of chemistry  or because they remain intrigued with each other  because of many kindnesses  because of luck. ... But part of it has got to be forgiveness and gratefulness.
data.author: Ellen Goodman

data.quote: For me it's not possible to forget  and I don't understand people who  when the love is ended  can bury the other person in hatred or oblivion. For me  a man I have loved becomes a kind of brother.
data.author: Jeanne Moreau

data.quote: Today I forgive all those who have ever offended me. I give my love to all thirsty hearts  both to those who love me and to those who do not love me.
data.author: Paramahansa Yogananda

data.quote: Experience is how life catches up with us and teaches us to love and forgive each other.
data.author: Judy Collins

data.quote: We never ask God to forgive anybody except when we haven't.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: Forgiveness is God's command.
data.author: Martin Luther

data.quote: God will forgive me  that is His business.
data.author: Heinrich Heine

data.quote: God will forgive me the foolish remarks I have made about Him just as I will forgive my opponents the foolish things they have written about me  even though they are spiritually as inferior to me as I to thee  O God!
data.author: Heinrich Heine

data.quote: Let all bitterness  and wrath  and anger  and clamour  and evil speaking  be put away from you  with all malice  and be ye kind to one another  tenderhearted  forgiving one another  even as God  for Christ's sake  hath forgiven you.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: I have looked on a lot of women with lust. I've committed adultery in my heart many times. God recognizes I will do this and forgives me.
data.author: Jimmy Carter

data.quote: How Forgiveness Helps Us Forgiveness is the answer to the child's dream of a miracle by which what is broken is made whole again  what is soiled is again made clean.
data.author: Dag Hammarskjold

data.quote: Forgiveness is all-powerful. Forgiveness heals all ills.
data.author: Catherine Ponder

data.quote: Those who are free of resentful thoughts surely find peace.
data.author: Buddha

data.quote: I can have peace of mind only when I forgive rather than judge.
data.author: Gerald Jampolsky

data.quote: The forgiving state of mind is a magnetic power for attracting good.
data.author: Catherine Ponder

data.quote: Judge not  that ye be not judged.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: It is in pardoning that we are pardoned.
data.author: Saint Francis of Assisi

data.quote: Forgiving those who hurt us is the key to personal peace.
data.author: G. Weatherly

data.quote: Forgive all who have offended you  not for them  but for yourself.
data.author: Harriet Uts Nelson

data.quote: To forgive is the highest  most beautiful form of love. In return  you will receive untold peace and happiness.

data.quote: Forgiveness is the key to action and freedom.

data.quote: Forgiveness is the way to true health and happiness.
data.author: Gerald Jampolsky

data.quote: Humanity is never so beautiful as when praying for forgiveness  or else forgiving another.

data.quote: Those who can't forget are worse off than those who can't remember.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Forgiveness is the remission of sins. For it is by this that what has been lost  and was found  is saved from being lost again.
data.author: Saint Augustine

data.quote: I can pardon everybody's mistakes except my own.
data.author: Marcus Porcius Cato

data.quote: If you haven't forgiven yourself something  how can you forgive others?
data.author: Dolores Huerta

data.quote: The moment an individual can accept and forgive himself  even a little  is the moment in which he becomes to some degree lovable.
data.author: Eugene Kennedy

data.quote: They may not deserve forgiveness  but I do.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: I forgive myself for having believed for so long that... I was never good enough to have  get  be what I wanted.
data.author: Ceanne DeRohan

data.quote: How unhappy is he who cannot forgive himself.
data.author: Publilius Syrus

data.quote: I learned that true forgiveness includes total self-acceptance. And out of acceptance wounds are healed and happiness is possible again.
data.author: Catharine Marshall

data.quote: Every man treats himself as society treats the criminal.
data.author: Harvey Fergusson

data.quote: To understand is to forgive  even oneself.
data.author: Alexander Chase

data.quote: Give us this day our daily bread. And forgive us our debts  as we forgive our debtors.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: He that cannot forgive others breaks the bridge over which he must pass himself  for every man has need to be forgiven.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: Always forgive your enemies  nothing annoys them so much.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: Forgiveness is the noblest vengeance.
data.author: H. G. Bohn

data.quote: There is no revenge so complete as forgiveness.
data.author: Josh Billings

data.quote: Many promising reconciliations have broken down because while both parties came prepared to forgive  neither party came prepared to be forgiven.
data.author: Charles William

data.quote: Forgiveness is man's deepest need and highest achievement.
data.author: Horace Bushnell

data.quote: Abandon your animosities and make your sons Americans!
data.author: Robert E. Lee

data.quote: Her breasts and arms ached with the beauty of her own forgiveness.
data.author: Meridel Le Sueur

data.quote: Life is an adventure in forgiveness.
data.author: Norman Cousins

data.quote: The cut worm forgives the plow.
data.author: William Blake

data.quote: Forgiveness is the highest and most difficult of all moral lessons.
data.author: Joseph Jacobs

data.quote: The fragrance of the violet sheds on the heel that has crushed it.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: How shall I love the sin  yet keep the sense  And love the offender  yet detest the offence?
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: Forgiveness is the giving  and so the receiving  of life.
data.author: George Macdonald

data.quote: Who would care to question the ground of forgiveness or compassion?

data.quote: O friends  I pray tonight  Keep not your kisses for my dead cold brow. The way is lonely  let me feel them now. Think gently of me  I am travel-worn  My faltering feet are pierced with many a thorn. Forgive! O hearts estranged  forgive  I plead! When ceaseless bliss is mine I shall not need The tenderness for which I long tonight.
data.author: Belle Eugenia Smith

data.quote: Let us forget and forgive injuries.
data.author: Miguel de Cervantes

data.quote: Even a stopped clock is right twice a day.
data.author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

data.quote: It is easier to forgive an enemy than a friend.
data.author: Madame Dorothee Deluzy

data.quote: It is very easy to forgive others their mistakes  it takes more grit and gumption to forgive them for having witnessed your own.
data.author: Jessamyn West

data.quote: When you pray for anyone you tend to modify your personal attitude toward him.
data.author: Norman Vincent Peale

data.quote: Forgiving means to pardon the unpardonable  faith means believing the unbelievable  and hoping means to hope when things are hopeless.
data.author: G. K. Chesterton

data.quote: To err is human  to forgive  divine.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: Normal day  let me be aware of the treasure you are. Let me learn from you  love you  bless you before you depart. Let me not pass you by in quest of some rare and perfect tomorrow. Let me hold you while I may  for it may not always be so. One day I shall dig my nails into the earth  or bury my face in the pillow  or stretch myself taut  or raise my hands to the sky and want  more than all the world  your return.
data.author: Mary Jean Iron

data.quote: The unthankful heart... discovers no mercies  but let the thankful heart sweep through the day and  as the magnet finds the iron  so it will find  in every hour  some heavenly blessings!
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: Joy is what happens to us when we allow ourselves to recognize how good things really are.
data.author: Marianne Williamson

data.quote: Good heavens  of what uncostly material is our earthly happiness composed ... if we only knew it. What incomes have we not had from a flower  and how unfailing are the dividends of the seasons.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: Be on the lookout for mercies. The more we look for them  the more of them we will see.... Better to loose count while naming your blessings than to lose your blessings to counting your troubles.
data.author: Maltbie D. Babcock

data.quote: The man who thinks his wife  his baby  his house  his horse  his dog  and himself severely unequalled  is almost sure to be a good-humored person.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: Every dog has its day  but it's not every dog that knows when he's having it.
data.author: Winifred Gordon

data.quote: We must give ourselves more earnestly and intelligently and generously than we have to the happy duty of appreciation.
data.author: Mariana Griswold Van Rensselaer

data.quote: There is nothing so bitter that a patient mind cannot find some solace for it.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: I thank You God for this most amazing day  for the leaping greenly spirits of trees and a blue true dream of sky  and for everything which is natural which is infinite which is yes.
data.author: e. e. cummings

data.quote: My private measure of success is daily. If this were to be the last day of my life would I be content with it? To live in a harmonious balance of commitments and pleasures is what I strive for.
data.author: Jane Rule

data.quote: Yes  there is a Nirvanah: it is in leading your sheep to a green pasture  and in putting your child to sleep  and in writing the last line of your poem.
data.author: Kahlil Gibran

data.quote: Blessed are those who can give without remembering and take without forgetting.
data.author: Elizabeth Asquith Bibesco

data.quote: That daily life is really good one appreciates when one wakes from a horrible dream  or when one takes the first outing after a sickness. Why not realize it now?
data.author: William Lyon Phelps

data.quote: Thank God every morning when you get up that you have something to do which must be done  whether you like it or not.
data.author: Charles Kingsley

data.quote: When I first open my eyes upon the morning meadows and look out upon the beautiful world  I thank God I am alive.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Each day comes bearing its own gifts. Untie the ribbons.
data.author: Ruth Ann Schabacker

data.quote: We can be thankful to a friend for a few acres or a little money  and yet for the freedom and command of the whole earth  and for the great benefits of our being  our life  health  and reason  we look upon ourselves as under no obligation.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: When something does not insist on being noticed  when we aren't grabbed by the collar or struck on the skull by a presence or an event  we take for granted the very things that most deserve our gratitude.
data.author: Cynthia Ozick

data.quote: Why do some people always see beautiful skies and grass and lovely flowers and incredible human beings  while others are hard-pressed to find anything or any place that is beautiful?
data.author: Leo Buscaglia

data.quote: Most human beings have an almost infinite capacity for taking things for granted.
data.author: Aldous Huxley

data.quote: My country ... gave me schooling  independence of action and opportunity for service. ... I am indebted to my country beyond any human power to repay.
data.author: Herbert Hoover

data.quote: Dwell upon the brightest parts in every prospect... and strive to be pleased with the present circumstances.
data.author: Abraham Tucker

data.quote: We are never either so wretched or so happy as we say we are.
data.author: Honore de Balzac

data.quote: The best things are nearest: breath in your nostrils  light in your eyes  flowers at your feet  duties at your hand  the path of God just before you. Then do not grasp at the stars  but do life's plain  common work as it comes  certain that daily duties and daily bread are the sweetest things of life.
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: Is life so wretched? Isn't it rather your hands which are too small  your vision which is muddled? You are the one who must grow up.
data.author: Dag Hammarskjold

data.quote: Looking for Silver Linings Our real blessings often appear to us in the shape of pains  losses and disappointments.
data.author: Joseph Addison

data.quote: Most of my major disappointments have turned out to be blessings in disguise. So whenever anything bad does happen to me  I kind of sit back and feel  well  if I give this enough time  it'll turn out that this was good  so I shan't worry about it too much.
data.author: William Gaines

data.quote: Sometimes the best deals are the ones you don't make.
data.author: Bill Veeck

data.quote: The advantages of a losing team: (i) There is everything to hope for and nothing to fear  (2.) Defeats do not disturb one's sleep. (3) An occasional victory is a surprise and a delight. (4) There is no danger of any club passing you. (5) You are not asked fifty times a day  "What was the score?"  people take it for granted that you lost.
data.author: Elmer E. Bates

data.quote: That which does not kill me makes me stronger.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: Not being beautiful was the true blessing. ... Not being beautiful forced me to develop my inner resources. The pretty girl has a handicap to overcome.
data.author: Golda Meir

data.quote: The difficulties  hardships and trials of life  the obstacles ... are positive blessings. They knit the muscles more firmly  and teach self-reliance.
data.author: William Matthews

data.quote: Many a man curses the rain that falls upon his head  and knows not that it brings abundance to drive away hunger.
data.author: Saint Basil

data.quote: Trouble is only opportunity in work clothes.
data.author: Henry J. Kaiser

data.quote: Adversity has the same effect on a man that severe training has on the pugilist: it reduces him to his fighting weight.
data.author: Josh Billings

data.quote: You will never be the person you can be if pressure  tension and discipline are taken out of your life.
data.author: Dr. James G. Bilkey

data.quote: Some troubles  like a protested note of a solvent debtor  bear interest.
data.author: Honore de Balzac

data.quote: Failure changes for the better  success for the worse.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: The basis of optimism is sheer terror.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: No evil is without its compensation ... it is not the loss itself  but the estimate of the loss  that troubles us.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: Let me embrace thee  sour adversity  for wise men say it is the wisest course.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Give thanks for sorrow that teaches you pity  for pain that teaches you courage-and give exceeding thanks for the mystery which remains a mystery still-the veil that hides you from the infinite  which makes it possible for you to believe in what you cannot see.
data.author: Robert Nathan

data.quote: A Christian could even give thanks for Hell  because Hell was a threat and a warning to keep him in the right way.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: To every disadvantage there is a corresponding advantage.
data.author: W. Clement Stone

data.quote: Too many people miss the silver lining because they're expecting gold.
data.author: Maurice Setter

data.quote: If you count all your assets  you always show a profit.
data.author: Robert Quillen

data.quote: Too happy would you be  did ye but know your own advantages!
data.author: Virgil

data.quote: Much unhappiness results from our inability to remember the nice things that happen to us.
data.author: W. N. Rieger

data.quote: If we go down into ourselves  we find that we possess exactly what we desire.
data.author: Simone Weil

data.quote: Be grateful for yourself... be thankful.
data.author: William Saroyan

data.quote: Keep a grateful journal. Every night  list five things that you are grateful for. What it will begin to do is change your perspective of your day and your life.
data.author: Oprah Winfrey

data.quote: There is no wealth but life.
data.author: John Ruskin

data.quote: Just to be is a blessing. Just to live is holy.
data.author: Abraham Heschel

data.quote: Life may be hard  but it's also wonderful.
data.author: Small Change

data.quote: I like living. I have sometimes been wildly  despairingly  acutely miserable  racked with sorrow  but through it all I still know quite certainly that just to be alive is a grand thing.
data.author: Agatha Christie

data.quote: Be glad of life because it gives you the chance to love  and to work  and to play and to look up at the stars.
data.author: Henry Van Dyke

data.quote: To be alive  to be able to see  to walk ... it's all a miracle. I have adapted the technique of living life from miracle to miracle.
data.author: Arthur Rubinstein

data.quote: This is another day! Are its eyes blurred With maudlin grief for any wasted past? A thousand thousand failures shall not daunt! Let dust clasp dust  death  death  I am alive!
data.author: Don Marquis

data.quote: The mere sense of living is joy enough.
data.author: Emily Dickinson

data.quote: However mean your life is  meet it and live it  do not shun it and call it hard names. It is not so bad as you are. It looks poorest when you are richest. The fault-finder will find faults even in Paradise. Love your life.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: Life is the first gift  love is the second  and understanding the third.
data.author: Marge Piercy

data.quote: To have a full stomach and fixed income are no small things .
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: For one mother  joy is the quiet pleasure found in gently rubbing shampoo into her young child's hair. For another woman it's taking a long walk alone  while for yet another it's reveling in a much-anticipated vacation.
data.author: Eileen Stukane

data.quote: How can they say my life is not a success? Have I not for more than sixty years gotten enough to eat and escaped being eaten?
data.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

data.quote: Sunshine is delicious  rain is refreshing  wind braces us up  snow is exhilarating  there is really no such thing as bad weather  only different kinds of good weather.
data.author: John Ruskin

data.quote: Only a stomach that rarely feels hungry scorns common things.
data.author: Horace

data.quote: My gratitude for good writing is unbounded  I'm grateful for it the way I'm grateful for the ocean.
data.author: Anne Lamott

data.quote: Is it so small a thing to have enjoyed the sun  to have lived light in the spring  to have loved  to have thought  to have done?
data.author: Matthew Arnold

data.quote: When something does not insist on being noticed  when we aren't grabbed by the collar or struck on the skull by a presence or an event  we take for granted the very things that most deserve our gratitude.
data.author: Cynthia Ozick

data.quote: You say grace before meals. All right. But I say grace before the concert and the opera  and grace before the play and pantomime  and grace before I open a book  and grace before sketching  painting  swimming  fencing  boxing  walking  playing  dancing and grace before I dip the pen in the ink.
data.author: G. K. Chesterton

data.quote: Thank God for dirty dishes  they have a tale to tell. While other folks go hungry  we're eating pretty well. With home  and health  and happiness  we shouldn't want to fuss  For by this stack of evidence  God's very good to us.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: It is strange what a contempt men have for the joys that are offered them freely.
data.author: Georges Duhamel

data.quote: Grateful for the blessing lent of simple tastes and mind content!
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: An easy thing  O Power Divine  To thank thee for these gifts of Thine  For summer's sunshine  winter's snow  For hearts that kindle  thoughts that glow  But when shall I attain to this- To thank Thee for the things I miss?
data.author: Thomas W. Higginson

data.quote: People call me an optimist  but I'm really an appreciator ... years ago  I was cured of a badly infected finger with antibiotics when once my doctor could have recommended only a hot water soak or  eventually  surgery.... When I was six years old and had scarlet fever  the first of the miracle drugs  sulfanilamide  saved my life. I'm grateful for computers and photocopiers ... I appreciate where we've come from.
data.author: Julian Simon

data.quote: If only the people who worry about their liabilities would think about the riches they do possess  they would stop worrying. Would you sell both your eyes for a million dollars ... or your two legs ... or your hands ... or your hearing? Add up what you do have  and you'll find that you won't sell them for all the gold in the world. The best things in life are yours  if you can appreciate yourself.
data.author: Dale Carnegie

data.quote: We can be thankful to a friend for a few acres or a little money  and yet for the freedom and command of the whole earth  and for the great benefits of our being  our life  health  and reason  we look upon ourselves as under no obligation.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: Health is ... a blessing that money cannot buy.
data.author: Izaak Walton

data.quote: Happiness lies  first of all  in health.
data.author: George William Curtis

data.quote: A sound mind in a sound body is a short but full description of a happy state in this world.
data.author: John Locke

data.quote: Health is the vital principle of bliss.
data.author: James Thomson

data.quote: If you can't be thankful for what you receive  be thankful for what you escape.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Even though we can't have all we want  we ought to be thankful we don't get all we deserve.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Happy the man who can count his sufferings.
data.author: Ovid

data.quote: Happiness is composed of misfortunes avoided.
data.author: Alphonse Karr

data.quote: Considering the fortune you might have lost  you'll have to admit you're rich already.
data.author: John Rothchild

data.quote: I thank Thee first because I was never robbed before  second  because although they took my purse they did not take my life  third  because although they took my all  it was not much  and fourth because it was I who was robbed  and not I who robbed.
data.author: Matthew Henry

data.quote: Think of the ills from which you are exempt.
data.author: Joseph Joubert

data.quote: A man should always consider ... how much more unhappy he might be than he is.
data.author: Joseph Addison

data.quote: The happiness of any given life is to be measured not by its joys and pleasures  but by the extent to which it has been free from suffering  from positive evil.
data.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

data.quote: Better to suffer than to die.
data.author: Jean de la Fontaine

data.quote: Better a little fire to warm us than a great one to burn us.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: It isn't important to come out on top. What matters is to come out alive.
data.author: Bertolt Brecht

data.quote: He who limps still walks.
data.author: Stanislaw Lee

data.quote: I have gout  asthma  and seven other maladies  but am otherwise very well.
data.author: Sydney Smith

data.quote: Luckily  I never feel at one time more than half my pains.
data.author: Joseph Joubert

data.quote: Pain is no longer pain when it is past.
data.author: Margaret Junkin Preston

data.quote: We are content to forgo joy when pain is also lost.
data.author: Latin proverb

data.quote: The happiest is he who suffers the least pain  the most miserable  he who enjoys the least pleasure.
data.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

data.quote: Happiness is not being pained in body  or troubled in mind.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: The end of pain we take as happiness.
data.author: Giacomo Leopardi

data.quote: You can be happy indeed if you have breathing space from pain.
data.author: Giacomo Leopardi

data.quote: The summit of pleasure is the elimination of all that gives pain.
data.author: Epicurus

data.quote: I seek the utmost pleasure and the least pain.
data.author: Plautus

data.quote: A prudent man will think more important what fate has conceded to him  than what it has denied.
data.author: Baltasar Gracian

data.quote: It is better to be looked over than overlooked.
data.author: Mae West

data.quote: Blessed are those who can give without remembering and take without forgetting.
data.author: Elizabeth Asquith Bibesco

data.quote: He is a man of sense who does not grieve for what he has not  but rejoices in what he has.
data.author: Epictetus

data.quote: Enjoy the successes that you have  and don't be too hard on yourself when you don't do well. Too many times we beat up on ourselves. Just relax and enjoy it.
data.author: Patty Sheehan

data.quote: For everything you have missed  you have gained something else.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Few love what they may have.
data.author: Ovid

data.quote: The knowledge that something remains yet unenjoyed impairs our enjoyment of the good before us.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: May we never let the things we can't have  or don't have  spoil our enjoyment of the things we do have and can have.
data.author: Richard L. Evans

data.quote: It is not customary to love what one has.
data.author: Anatole France

data.quote: The talent for being happy is appreciating and liking what you have  instead of what you don't have.
data.author: Woody Allen

data.quote: Happy thou art not  for what thou hast not  still thou striv'est to get  and what thou hast  forget'est.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Men ... always think that something they are going to get is better than what they have got.
data.author: John Oliver Hobbes

data.quote: When we cannot get what we love  we must love what is within our reach.
data.author: French proverb

data.quote: Take full account of the excellencies which you possess  and in gratitude remember how you would hanker after them  if you had them not.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: A wise man cares not for what he cannot have.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: A man can refrain from wanting what he has not  and cheerfully make the best of a bird in the hand.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: Long only for what you have.
data.author: Andre Gide

data.quote: The tulip is  among flowers  what the peacock is among birds. A tulip lacks scent  a peacock has an unpleasant voice. The one takes pride in its garb  the other in its tail.
data.author: French proverb

data.quote: Slight not what is near though aiming at what is far.
data.author: Euripides

data.quote: Greediness of getting more  deprives ... the enjoyment of what it had got.
data.author: Thomas Sprat

data.quote: There is a mortal breed most full of futility. In contempt of what is at hand  they strain into the future  hunting impossibilities on the wings of ineffectual hopes.
data.author: Pindar

data.quote: What you really value is what you miss  not what you have.
data.author: Jorge Luis Borges

data.quote: While you fear missing a meal  you aren't fully aware of the meals you do eat.
data.author: Dan Millman

data.quote: To be upset over what you don't have is to waste what you do have.
data.author: Ken Keyes

data.quote: If there's no bread  cakes are very good.
data.author: Spanish proverb

data.quote: Not what we have  but what we enjoy  constitutes our abundance.
data.author: J. Petit-Senn

data.quote: Not what we have  but what we use  not what we see  but what we choose-these are the things that mar or bless human happiness.
data.author: Joseph Fort Newton

data.quote: The happiness which is lacking makes one think even the happiness one has unbearable.

data.quote: We always have enough to be happy if we are enjoying what we do have- and not worrying about what we don't have.
data.author: Ken Keyes

data.quote: Welcome everything that comes to you  but do not long for anything else.

data.quote: The superiority of the distant over the present is only due to the mass and variety of the pleasures that can be suggested  compared with the poverty of those that can at any time be felt.
data.author: George Santayana

data.quote: If there is a sin against life  it consists perhaps not so much in despairing of life as in hoping for another  and in eluding the implacable grandeur of this life.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.quote: Mankind  by the perverse depravity of their nature  esteem that which they have most desired as of no value the moment it is possessed  and torment themselves with fruitless wishes for that which is beyond their reach.
data.author: Francois de Fenelon

data.quote: All your youth you want to have your greatness taken for granted  when you find it taken for granted  you are unnerved.
data.author: Elizabeth Bowen

data.quote: Do not spoil what you have by desiring what you have not  remember that what you now have was once among the things only hoped for.
data.author: Epicurus

data.quote: It ain't so much trouble to get rich as it is to tell when we have got rich.

data.quote: What you have become is the price you paid to get what you used to want.
data.author: Mignon McLaughlin

data.quote: No man can be satisfied with his attainment  although he may be satisfied with his circumstances.
data.author: Frank Swinnerton

data.quote: Life is a progress from want to want  not from enjoyment to enjoyment.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: We spend our time searching for security and hate it when we get it.
data.author: John Steinbeck

data.quote: There must be more to life than having everything.
data.author: Maurice Sendak

data.quote: Is there no end to this escalation of desire?

data.quote: Ambition has its disappointments to sour us  but never the good fortune to satisfy us.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: There is no banquet but some dislike something in it.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: If we get everything that we want  we will soon want nothing that we get.
data.author: Vernon Luchies

data.quote: It matters very little whether a man is discontented in the name of pessimism or progress  if his discontent does in fact paralyse his power of appreciating what he has got.
data.author: G. K. Chesterton

data.quote: The best things in life are appreciated most after they have been lost.
data.author: Roy L. Smith

data.quote: Only with a new ruler do you realize the value of the old.
data.author: Burmese proverb

data.quote: I remember those happy days and often wish I could speak into the ears of the dead the gratitude which was due to them in life and so ill-returned.
data.author: Gwyn Thomas

data.quote: You can't appreciate home until you've left it  money till it's spent  your wife till she's joined a woman's club  nor Old Glory till you see it hanging on a broomstick on the shanty of a consul in a foreign town.
data.author: O. Henry

data.quote: Birds sing after a storm  why shouldn't people feel as free to delight in whatever remains to them?
data.author: Rose Fitzgerald Kennedy

data.quote: Think of all the beauty still left around you and be happy.
data.author: Anne Frank

data.quote: Oh  my friend  it's not what they take away from you that counts-it's what you do with what you have left.

data.quote: God gave you a gift of 86 400 seconds today. Have you used one to say "thank you"?
data.author: William A. Ward

data.quote: So long as we can lose any happiness  we possess some.

data.quote: Happiness always looks small while you hold it in your hands  but let it go  and you learn at once how big and precious it is.
data.author: Maxim Gorky

data.quote: After my mother's death  I began to see her as she had really been.... It was less like losing someone than discovering someone.
data.author: Nancy Hale

data.quote: We never know the worth of water till the well is dry.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: The way to love anything is to realize that it may be lost.
data.author: G. K. Chesterton

data.quote: Jesus  please teach me to appreciate what I have before time forces me to appreciate what I had.
data.author: Susan L. Lenzkes

data.quote: Eden is that old-fashioned house we dwell in every day Without suspecting our abode  until we drive away.
data.author: Emily Dickinson

data.quote: Generally the man with a good wife  or the woman with a good husband  or the children with good parents discover too late the goodness they overlooked while it was in full bloom.
data.author: James Douglas

data.quote: Jesus  please teach me to appreciate what I have  before time forces me to appreciate what I had.
data.author: Susan L. Lenzkes

data.quote: The Pilgrims made seven times more graves than huts. No Americans have been more impoverished than these who  nevertheless  set aside a day of thanksgiving.
data.author: H. U. Westermayer

data.quote: The greatest saint in the world is not he who prays most or fasts most  it is not he who gives alms  or is most eminent for temperance  chastity or justice. It is he who is most thankful to God.

data.quote: Not what we say about our blessings  but how we use them  is the true measure of our thanksgiving.
data.author: W. T. Purkiser

data.quote: The unthankful heart... discovers no mercies  but the thankful heart... will find  in every hour  some heavenly blessings.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: Thanksgiving is a sure index of spiritual health.
data.author: Maurice Dametz

data.quote: If the only prayer you say in your whole life is "Thank you " that would suffice.
data.author: Meister Eckhart

data.quote: Who does not thank for little will not thank for much.
data.author: Estonian proverb

data.quote: The beginning of men's rebellion against God was  and is  the lack of a thankful heart.

data.quote: A thankful heart is not only the greatest virtue  but the parent of all other virtues.
data.author: Cicero

data.quote: Seeds of discouragement will not grow in the thankful heart.

data.quote: The private and personal blessings we enjoy-the blessings of immunity  safeguard  liberty and integrity- deserve the thanksgiving of a whole life.

data.quote: Gratitude unlocks the fullness of life. It turns what we have into enough  and more. It turns denial into acceptance  chaos to order  confusion to clarity. It can turn a meal into a feast  a house into a home  a stranger into a friend. Gratitude makes sense of our past  brings peace for today  and creates a vision for tomorrow.
data.author: Melody Beattie

data.quote: Remember that not to be happy is not to be grateful.
data.author: Elizabeth Carter

data.quote: Gratitude weighs heavy on us only when we no longer feel it.
data.author: Comtesse Diane

data.quote: Appreciation is yeast  lifting ordinary to extraordinary.
data.author: Mary-Ann Petro

data.quote: Gratitude is the memory of the heart.
data.author: Jean Baptiste Massieu

data.quote: One can never pay in gratitude  one can only pay "in kind" somewhere else in life.
data.author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

data.quote: Silent gratitude isn't much use to anyone.

data.quote: Happiness is itself a kind of gratitude.

data.quote: One cannot collect all the beautiful shells on the beach.
data.author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

data.quote: A man who accustoms himself to buy superfluities is often in want of necessities.

data.quote: There is a great difference between satisfaction and satiation.

data.quote: More than enough is too much.

data.quote: Sufficiency's enough for men of sense.

data.quote: This only grant me  that my means may lie too low for envy  for contempt too high.

data.quote: Moderation is the key to lasting enjoyment.

data.quote: Nothing in excess.

data.quote: Ask the gods nothing excessive.

data.quote: To be able to dispense with good things is tantamount to possessing them.

data.author: Donald Horban

data.quote: The hardest thing is to take less when you can get more.

data.quote: Whoever does not regard what he has as most ample wealth is unhappy  though he is master of the world.

data.quote: How few are our real wants  and how easy is it to satisfy them! Our imaginary ones are boundless and insatiable.

data.quote: Of all the people in the world  those who want the most are those who have the most.

data.quote: The heart is great which shows moderation in the midst of prosperity.

data.quote: How many things there are which I do not want.

data.quote: One is never fortunate or as unfortunate as one imagines.

data.quote: Man needs so little ... yet he begins wanting so much.

data.quote: Man never has what he wants  because what he wants is everything.

data.quote: If your desires be endless  your cares and fears will be so  too.

data.quote: We are no longer happy so soon as we wish to be happier.

data.quote: He is not rich that possesses much  but he that covets no more  and he is not poor that enjoys little  but he that wants too much.

data.quote: Independence may be found in comparative as well as in absolute abundance  I mean where a person contracts his desires within the limits of his fortune.

data.quote: One never hugs one's good luck so affectionately as when listening to the relation of some horrible misfortunes which has overtaken others.

data.quote: If you would but exchange places with the other fellow  how much more you could appreciate your own position.

data.quote: I wept because I had no shoes  until I saw a man who had no feet.

data.quote: When life's problems seem overwhelming  look around and see what other people are coping with. You may consider yourself fortunate.

data.quote: If all misfortunes were laid in one common heap whence everyone must take an equal portion  most people would be contented to take their own and depart.

data.quote: Not he who has little  but he who wishes more  is poor.

data.quote: The covetous man is always poor.

data.quote: He is not poor that hath not much  but he that craves much.

data.quote: He is poor who does not feel content.

data.quote: I have no riches but my thoughts. Yet these are wealth enough for me.

data.quote: He who curbs his desires will always be rich enough.

data.quote: There is a gigantic difference between earning a great deal of money and being rich.

data.quote: That man is richest whose pleasures are the cheapest.

data.quote: If you want an accounting of your worth  count your friends.

data.quote: I've had an exciting life  I married for love and got a little money along with it.

data.quote: True affluence is not needing anything.

data.quote: There are many excuses for the person who made the mistake of confounding money and wealth. Like many others they mistook the sign for the thing signified.

data.quote: To be satisfied with what one has  that is wealth. As long as one sorely needs a certain additional amount  that man isn't rich.

data.quote: I have the greatest of all riches: that of not desiring them.

data.quote: My friends are my estate.

data.quote: A man is rich in proportion to the things he can afford to let alone.

data.quote: There are people who have money and people who are rich.

data.quote: He is rich that is satisfied.

data.quote: Nor need we power or splendor  wide hall or lordly dome  the good  the true  the tender-these form the wealth of home.

data.quote: He is well paid that is well satisfied.

data.quote: He who is content in his poverty is wonderfully rich.

data.quote: He who is contented is rich.

data.quote: A BMW can't take you as far as a diploma.

data.quote: All fortune belongs to him who has a contented mind.

data.quote: The greatest wealth is contentment with a little.

data.quote: No one has yet had the courage to memorialize his wealth on his tombstone. A dollar mark would not look well there.
data.author: Corra May Harris

data.quote: So many of us define ourselves by what we have  what we wear  what kind of house we live in  and what kind of car we drive ... if you think of yourself as the woman in the Cartier watch and the Hermes scarf  a house fire will destroy not only your possessions but your self.

data.quote: The externals are simply so many props  everything we need is within us.

data.quote: He is not rich that possesses much  but he that is content with what he has.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: One well-cultivated talent  deepened and enlarged  is worth one hundred shallow faculties.
data.author: William Matthews

data.quote: If only every man would make proper use of his strength and do his utmost  he need never regret his limited ability.
data.author: Cicero

data.quote: Anyone is to be pitied who has just sense enough to perceive his deficiencies.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: What strange perversity is it that induces a man to set his heart on doing those things which he has not succeeded in  and makes him slight those in which his achievement has been respectable.
data.author: Gamaliel Bradford

data.quote: I may not amount to much  but at least I am unique.

data.quote: Happy is the man who can do only one thing: in doing it  he fulfills his destiny.
data.author: Joseph Joubert

data.quote: The real tragedy of life is not being limited to one talent  but in failing to use that one talent.

data.quote: Nothing will content him who is not content with a little.

data.quote: Contentment is worth more than riches.

data.quote: I figure if I have my health  can pay the rent and I have my friends  I call it "content."
data.author: Lauren Bacall

data.quote: Be content with what thou hast received  and smooth thy frowning forehead.
data.author: Hafez

data.quote: He is poor who does not feel content.

data.quote: If thou covetest riches  ask not but for contentment  which is an immense treasure.

data.quote: Who is content with nothing possesses all things.

data.quote: My crown is called content  a crown that seldom kings enjoy.

data.quote: It is right to be contented with what we have  never with what we are.
data.author: Mackintosh

data.quote: Be content with your lot  one cannot be first in everything.

data.author: Sir Thomas Browne

data.quote: He is not rich that possesses much  but he that is content with what he has.
data.author: Anonymous

data.author: G. K. Chesterton

data.quote: Poor and content is rich  and rich enough.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: The greatest wealth is contentment with a little.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: And be content with such things as ye have.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Everything has its wonders  even darkness and silence  and I learn  whatever state I may be in  therein to be content.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: Try to live the life of the good man who is more than content with what is allocated to him.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: The world is full of people looking for spectacular happiness while they snub contentment.
data.author: Doug Larson

data.quote: We are never content with our lot.
data.author: Jean de la Fontaine

data.quote: Until you make peace with who you are  you'll never be content with what you have.
data.author: Doris Mortman

data.quote: True contentment depends not upon what we have  a tub was large enough for Diogenes  but a world was too little for Alexander.
data.author: Charles Caleb Colton

data.quote: To be content with little is difficult  to be content with much  impossible.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Reflect upon your present blessings  of which every man has many  not on your past misfortunes  of which all men have some.
data.author: Charles Dickens

data.quote: No longer forward nor behind I look in hope or fear  But  grateful  take the good I find  The best of now and here.
data.author: John Greenleaf Whittier

data.quote: What a wonderful life I've had! I only wish I'd realized it sooner.
data.author: Colette

data.quote: Was it always my nature to take a bad time and block out the good times  until any success became an accident and failure seemed the only truth?
data.author: Lillian Hellman

data.quote: Most human beings have an almost infinite capacity for taking things for granted.
data.author: Aldous Huxley

data.quote: There are men who are happy without knowing it.
data.author: Vauvenargues

data.quote: We are all of us richer than we think we are.
data.author: Michel de Montaigne

data.quote: What a miserable thing life is: you're living in clover  only the clover isn't good enough.
data.author: Bertolt Brecht

data.quote: I am convinced  the longer I live  that life and its blessings are not so entirely unjustly distributed as when we are suffering greatly we are inclined to suppose.
data.author: Mary Todd Lincoln

data.quote: Life is hard. Next to what?
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Over a period of time it's been driven home to me that I'm not going to be the most popular writer in the world  so I'm always happy when anything in any way is accepted.
data.author: Stephen Sondheim

data.quote: It made me gladsome to be getting some education  it being like a big window opening.
data.author: Mary Webb

data.quote: Too much of a good thing can be wonderful.
data.author: Mae West

data.quote: A man with ambition and love for his blessings here on earth is ever so alive. Having been alive  it won't be so hard in the end to lie down and rest.
data.author: Pearl Bailey

data.quote: In the country of the blind  the one-eyed man is king.
data.author: Michael Apostolius

data.quote: Be satisfied  and pleased with what thou art  Act cheerfully and well thou allotted part  Enjoy the present hour  be thankful for the past  And neither fear  nor wish  the approaches of the last.
data.author: Martial

data.quote: No one is satisfied with his fortune  or dissatisfied with his intellect.
data.author: Antoinette Deshouliere

data.quote: Tis better to have loved and lost than never to have loved at all.
data.author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

data.quote: God pardons like a mother  who kisses the offense into everlasting forgetfulness.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: Good  to forgive  Best  to forget.
data.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

data.quote: It is easier to forgive an enemy than a friend.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: His heart was as great as the world  but there was no room in it to hold the memory of a wrong.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Bear and forbear.
data.author: Epictetus

data.quote: Forgive us our trespasses  as we forgive them that trespass against us.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: To err is human  to forgive  divine.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: Forgive others often  yourself never.
data.author: Syrus

data.quote: It is manlike to punish but godlike to forgive.
data.author: Peter von Winter

data.quote: Fortune makes him fool  whom she makes her darling.
data.author: Sir Francis Bacon

data.quote: It is fortune  not wisdom  that rules man's life.
data.author: Cicero

data.quote: Fortune truly helps those who are of good judgment.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The bitter dregs of Fortune's cup to drain.
data.author: Homer

data.quote: Fortunes made in no time are like shirts made in no time  it's ten to one if they hang long together.
data.author: Douglas Jerrold

data.quote: Men are seldom blessed with good fortune and good sense at the same time.
data.author: Livy

data.quote: Fortune and Love befriend the bold.
data.author: Ovid

data.quote: Every man is the architect of his own fortune.
data.author: Sallust

data.quote: O fortune  fortune! all men call thee fickle.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: There is a tide in the affairs of men Which  taken at the flood  leads on to fortune.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: A sleeping fox counts hens in his dreams.
data.author: Russian proverb

data.quote: Frailty  thy name is woman!
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: An amiable weakness.
data.author: R. B. Sheridan

data.quote: Forty million Frenchmen can't be wrong.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: France  freed from that monster  Bonaparte  must again become the most agreeable country on earth. It would be the second choice of all whose ties of family and fortune give a preference to some other one  and the first choice of all not under those ties.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: Ye sons of France  awake to glory! Hark! Hark! what myriads bid you rise! Your children  wives and grandsires hoary  Behold their tears and hear their cries!
data.author: Rouget de Lisle

data.quote: France always has plenty men of talent  but it is always deficient in men of action and high character.
data.author: Napoleon

data.quote: The cause of freedom is the cause of God.
data.author: Samuel Bowles

data.quote: Life is not so short but that there is always time enough for courtesy.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: A decent boldness ever meets with friends.
data.author: Homer

data.quote: It is not enough to succeed  a friend must fail.
data.author: La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: A friend in power is a friend lost.
data.author: Henry Adams

data.quote: A friend is one before whom I may think aloud.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Iron sharpeneth man  so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Chance makes our parents  but choice makes our friends.
data.author: Jacques Delille

data.quote: Hope is a pleasant acquaintance  but an unsafe friend.
data.author: Thomas Chandler Haliburton

data.quote: Money can't buy friends  but you can get a better class of enemy.
data.author: Spike Milligan

data.quote: Every time I paint a portrait I lose a friend.
data.author: John Singer Sargent

data.quote: My heart is warm with the friends I make  And better friends I'll not be knowing  Yet there isn't a train I wouldn't take  No matter where it's going.
data.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

data.quote: A sympathetic friend can be quite dear as a brother.
data.author: Homer

data.quote: Friends are relatives you make for yourself.
data.author: Eustache Deschamps

data.quote: A good friend is my nearest relation.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: The rich know not who is his friend.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The richer your friends  the more they will cost you.
data.author: Elizabeth Marbury

data.quote: A friend in need is a friend indeed.
data.author: Susan Ferrier

data.quote: It is easier to forgive an enemy than a friend.
data.author: Madame Dorothee Deluzy

data.quote: Man's best support is a very dear friend.
data.author: Cicero

data.quote: If you want an accounting of your worth  count your friends.
data.author: Merry Browne

data.quote: A true friend is the best possession.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Best friend  my well-spring in the wilderness!
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: A friend should be a master at guessing and keeping still.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: I have lost friends  some by death ... others by sheer inability to cross the street.
data.author: Virginia Woolf

data.quote: Faithful are the wounds of a friend  but the kisses of an enemy are deceitful.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: An old friend never can be found  and nature has provided that he cannot easily be lost.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: One who's our friend is fond of us  one who's fond of us isn't necessarily our friend.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: True friends ... face in the same direction  toward common projects  interests  goals.
data.author: C. S. Lewis

data.quote: Friends are a second existence.
data.author: Baltasar Gracian

data.quote: My helpless friend  your helplessness is the most powerful plea which rises up to the tender father-heart of God. You think that everything is closed to you because you cannot pray. My friend  your helplessness is the very essence of prayer.
data.author: O. Hallesby
